Tester - Contractor(IBM) Oncor Electric Delivery July 2013  – Present (2 years 2 months) Lansing, Michigan Area Project Description: The Oncor Mainframe Modernization Program is an initiative to replace Oncor Electric Delivery’s Mainframe Application Portfolio with new software applications, migrate all mainframe applications to operate on a distributed computing environment and eliminate reliance on the mainframe. The MMP will also be used to establish an enterprise disaster recovery solution for MMP and an enterprise security / data management infrastructure. 
 
My role on the MMP project was as a System Integration Tester.  
As a tester my testing role was focused on and tasks focused on the B2B Gateway and various aspects of ORACLE’S CC&B (Customer Care and Billing). One simple example would be testing the B2B gateway (SBI – Sterling Business Integrator) for proper processing of EDI transactions that were transmitted from TDSP (Transmission Distribution Service Provider) to the Market and vice versa.  
Some of the examples of these EDI transactions are: Service Orders, Move Out/IN Request, Historical Usage Request, Remittance Advice, Initial Meter Read, and Outage Notification. 
During CC&B testing, the team and I were tasked with testing: configuration settings of CC&B, the converted data originating from the production system, and extensions that were added to the CC&B solution. Research Assistant Jackson State University August 2013  –  May 2015  (1 year 10 months) Jackson, Mississippi Area The goal of the Student Open Source Software (SOSS) Community project is to educate Computer Science (CS) students through real-world software development activities in order to produce a well-educated and well-trained workforce. This project introduces a student-centered open source software community as a supplementary educational model to the traditional lecture-based teaching environment. The objectives of the SOSS Community are as follows: 
 
• To provide a virtual classroom for CS majors at any level  
• To produce software source code for Jackson State University (JSU) communities 
• To develop an educational model utilizing OSS products and the OSS community. 
 
The strategies to accomplish the proposed objectives are to use and adopt OSS community structures and OSS products. The server is complete and now functioning for couple of courses. Though we have projects that me and my team currently working that can be incorporated to this project. Summer Intern Purdue School of Engineering and Technology, IUPUI May 2014  –  July 2014  (3 months) Indianapolis, Indiana Area Evaluating the performance of the Android operating system and its applications is imperative to ensuring both the operating systems and its applications are using resources optimally. The objective of this research is to instrument Android mobile devices in real-time. This is important because it will allow us to analyze its performance properties (e.g., performance anomalies, trends in resource usage over time, and best/worst-case scenarios for individual applications) of Android devices while it is executing the 10s to 100s of applications running on a single device. Summer Intern Indiana University Bloomington May 2013  –  July 2013  (3 months) Bloomington, Indiana Area Under School Informatics and Computing (PHIT Lab) 
 
I had the chance to work with Dr. Kay Connelly in building a different prototype that will assist the elderly adult under the project called SOLACE. SOLACE is a new PHIT Lab project that will provide guidance to community members, service providers, and governmental agencies about how to wield technology to enable low-SES, urban- and rural-dwelling older adults to age in place, while simultaneously easing the burden on caregivers. This is important because it will allow us to analyze its performance properties (e.g., performance anomalies, trends in resource usage over time, and best/worst-case scenarios for individual applications) of Android devices while it is executing the 10s to 100s of applications running on a single device.
